body_html:
Fixing this is a little tricky because our CPU builds are currently setup to NOT use Conda.

What we should probably do is reconfigure out GCC version tests to use conda with different versions of GCC (instead of the Travis Python) because this is a more accurate representation of what our users will use.

I assigned @yf225 because you setup the CPU initially.
body_text:
Fixing this is a little tricky because our CPU builds are currently setup to NOT use Conda.
What we should probably do is reconfigure out GCC version tests to use conda with different versions of GCC (instead of the Travis Python) because this is a more accurate representation of what our users will use.
I assigned @yf225 because you setup the CPU initially.
body:
Fixing this is a little tricky because our CPU builds are currently setup to NOT use Conda. 

What we should probably do is reconfigure out GCC version tests to use conda with different versions of GCC (instead of the Travis Python) because this is a more accurate representation of what our users will use.

I assigned @yf225 because you setup the CPU initially.
